title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 80-5.24 - Residency certificate
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 80-5.24 - Residency certificate

State Regulations
(a) A candidate
who is enrolled in a registered residency program pursuant to section
52.21
of this Title, may, upon
submission of an application with a recommendation by the partnering
institution of higher education and a recommendation by the partnering school, school district, or board of cooperative educational services, receive a
residency certificate under this section. (b) This certificate shall only be issued to
candidates who submit satisfactory evidence of having a commitment from the
partnering school, school district, or board of cooperative educational
services of employment for the length of the residency program and a plan for
providing mentoring and instructional support to the candidate. (c) General requirements. (1)

Time validity. The certificate shall be
valid for no more than three years from its effective date; provided however, the certificate shall have an earlier expiration date if the candidate
successfully completes the residency program, as determined by the partnering
institution of higher education; or exits the program, as determined by the
partnering higher education institution. If such earlier expiration date occurs
for a candidate who successfully completes the program, the expiration date
shall be three months after the date of the institutional recommendation for
the initial or professional certificate in the subject area of the certificate
sought. (2)

Limitations. The
certificate shall authorize a candidate to work only in a school, school
district, or board of cooperative educational services for which a commitment
for employment and mentoring has been made. The candidate shall not be the
teacher of record. (3)

For
candidates called to active duty in the Armed Forces, the validity period of
the residency certificate may be extended for the time of active service and an
additional 12 months from the end of such service, provided that the holder is
a candidate in a registered residency program pursuant to section
52.21
of this

Title. (d) Upon
successful completion of the residency program, as determined by the partnering
higher education institution and partnering school, school district, or board
of cooperative educational services, co-teaching experience during the
residency experience may be credited toward the experience required for the
candidate's professional teaching certificate; provided that such experience
meets the requirements set forth in section
80-3.4
of this Part. Notes
